eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='margin:0in 0in 0pt'><b>NOTE 1 &#150; ORGANIZATION AND BASIS OF PRESENTATION</b></p> <p style='margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>Trxade Group, Inc. (&#145;we&#146;, &#145;our&#146;, the &#147;Company&#148;) owns 100% of Trxade, Inc. </p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>Trxade, Inc. is a web based market platform that enables trade among healthcare buyers and sellers of pharmaceuticals, accessories and services. </p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>In December 2016, the Company sold Westminster Pharmaceutical LLC. Westminster provided US state licensed pharmacies and other buying groups with FDA approved pharmaceuticals. The Westminster Pharmaceuticals LLC division, which was sold in December 2016, is included in the consolidated financial statements as discontinued operations and is fully described in Note 3 &#150; DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS.&#148;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'><i>Basis of Presentation</i> - The accompanying unaudited interim financial statements of Trxade Group, Inc. have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America and the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, and should be read in conjunction with the audited financial statements and notes thereto contained in the Company&#146;s Form 10K. </p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>In the opinion of management, all adjustments, consisting of normal recurring adjustments, necessary for a fair presentation of financial position and the results of operations for the interim periods presented have been reflected herein. The results of operations for the interim periods are not necessarily indicative of the results to be expected for the full year. Notes to the financial statements that would substantially duplicate the disclosures contained in the audited financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2016 as reported in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10K have been omitted</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'><i>Income (loss) Per Common Share</i> &#150; Basic net income (loss) per common share is computed by dividing net income (loss) available to common stockholders by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding. Diluted net income (loss) per common share is computed similar to basic net loss per common share except that the denominator is increased to include the number of additional common shares that would have been outstanding if the potential common shares had been issued and if the additional common shares were dilutive. The dilutive effect of the Company&#146;s options and warrants is computed using the treasury stock method while the dilutive effect of our convertible notes is computed using the if-converted method. At March 31, 2016, diluted net loss per share is equivalent to basic net loss per share as the inclusion of any shares committed to be issued would be anti-dilutive. </p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='margin:0in 0in 0pt'>The following table sets forth the computation of basic and diluted Loss per Share:</p> <p style='margin:0in 0in eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='margin:0in 0in 0pt'><b>NOTE 1 &#150; ORGANIZATION AND BASIS OF PRESENTATION</b></p> <p style='margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>Trxade Group, Inc. (&#145;we&#146;, &#145;our&#146;, the &#147;Company&#148;) owns 100% of Trxade, Inc. </p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>Trxade, Inc. is a web based market platform that enables trade among healthcare buyers and sellers of pharmaceuticals, accessories and services. </p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>In December 2016, the Company sold Westminster Pharmaceutical LLC. Westminster provided US state licensed pharmacies and other buying groups with FDA approved pharmaceuticals. The Westminster Pharmaceuticals LLC division, which was sold in December 2016, is included in the consolidated financial statements as discontinued operations and is fully described in Note 3 &#150; DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS.&#148;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'><i>Basis of Presentation</i> - The accompanying unaudited interim financial statements of Trxade Group, Inc. have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America and the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, and should be read in conjunction with the audited financial statements and notes thereto contained in the Company&#146;s Form 10K. </p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>In the opinion of management, all adjustments, consisting of normal recurring adjustments, necessary for a fair presentation of financial position and the results of operations for the interim periods presented have been reflected herein. The results of operations for the interim periods are not necessarily indicative of the results to be expected for the full year. Notes to the financial statements that would substantially duplicate the disclosures contained in the audited financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2016 as reported in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10K have been omitted</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'><i>Income (loss) Per Common Share</i> &#150; Basic net income (loss) per common share is computed by dividing net income (loss) available to common stockholders by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding. Diluted net income (loss) per common share is computed similar to basic net loss per common share except that the denominator is increased to include the number of additional common shares that would have been outstanding if the potential common shares had been issued and if the additional common shares were dilutive. The dilutive effect of the Company&#146;s options and warrants is computed using the treasury stock method while the dilutive effect of our convertible notes is computed using the if-converted method. At March 31, 2016, diluted net loss per share is equivalent to basic net loss per share as the inclusion of any shares committed to be issued would be anti-dilutive. </p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='margin:0in 0in 0pt'>The following table sets forth the computation of basic and diluted Loss per Share:</p> <p style='margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="552" style='width:413.75pt;border-collapse:collapse'>  <tr style='height:9.3pt'> <td valign="bottom" Accounting Pronouncements </i>&#150; The Company has implemented all new relevant accounting pronouncements that are in effect through the date of these financial statements. The pronouncements did not have any material impact on the financial statements unless otherwise disclosed, and the Company does not believe that there are any other new accounting pronouncements that have been issued that might have a material impact on its consolidated financial position or results of operations.</p>

<link:label xlink:type='resource' xlink:label='lab_us-gaap_OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock' xlink:role='http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/terseLabel' xml:lang='en-US'>ORGANIZATION AND BASIS OF PRESENTATION</link:label>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 2 &#150; GOING CONCERN</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">These consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles applicable to a going concern which contemplates the realization of assets and the satisfaction of liabilities and commitments in the normal course of business. The ability of the Company to continue as a going concern is dependent on raising additional capital and generating future profitable operations. There can be no assurance that the Company will be able to raise the necessary funds when needed to finance its ongoing costs.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">The Company&#146;s future capital requirements will depend on many factors, including cash flow from operations, costs to complete platform improvements, if warranted, and competition and market conditions. The Company&#146;s recurring operating losses and working capital needs will require that it obtain additional capital to operate its business. Given the Company&#146;s limited operating history, lack of revenues, and its operating losses, there can be no assurance that it will be able to achieve and maintain profitability. Accordingly, these factors raise substantial doubt about the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern. The consolidated financial statements do not include any adjustments that might result from the outcome of this uncertainty.</font></p></us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock>
eleList.name: SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock
eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 2 &#150; GOING CONCERN</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">These consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles applicable to a going concern which contemplates the realization of assets and the satisfaction of liabilities and commitments in the normal course of business. The ability of the Company to continue as a going concern is dependent on raising additional capital and generating future profitable operations. There can be no assurance that the Company will be able to raise the necessary funds when needed to finance its ongoing costs.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">The Company&#146;s future capital requirements will depend on many factors, including cash flow from operations, costs to complete platform improvements, if warranted, and competition and market conditions. The Company&#146;s recurring operating losses and working capital needs will require that it obtain additional capital to operate its business. Given the Company&#146;s limited operating history, lack of revenues, and its operating losses, there can be no assurance that it will be able to achieve and maintain profitability. Accordingly, these factors raise substantial doubt about the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern. The consolidated financial statements do not include any adjustments that might result from the outcome of this uncertainty.</font></p>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:NatureOfOperations contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 3 &#150; DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">On December 31, 2016, the Company entered into a contract and consummated the sale of 100% of its equity interests in its wholly-owned subsidiary, Westminster Pharmaceuticals, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (&#147;Westminster&#148;). The purchase price was the transfer of $1,197,354 of assets, the transfer of $(3,908,296) of liabilities, 1,500,000 warrants issued with a fair market value of $688,143 which was calculated based on Black-Scholes model, cancellation of $1,557,810 intercompany balance due to Trxade Group, Inc. and remaining debt discount of $267,381 being written off. The transaction resulted in a gain of $197,608. The schedule below summarizes the sale arrangement:</font></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="325" eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 3 &#150; DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">On December 31, 2016, the Company entered into a contract and consummated the sale of 100% of its equity interests in its wholly-owned subsidiary, Westminster Pharmaceuticals, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (&#147;Westminster&#148;). The purchase price was the transfer of $1,197,354 of assets, the transfer of $(3,908,296) of liabilities, 1,500,000 warrants issued with a fair market value of $688,143 which was calculated based on Black-Scholes model, cancellation of $1,557,810 intercompany balance due to Trxade Group, Inc. and remaining debt discount of $267,381 being written off. The transaction resulted in a gain of $197,608. The schedule below summarizes the sale arrangement:</font></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="325" eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 4 &#150;DEBT AND RELATED PARTIES DEBT</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">Convertible Promissory Note</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">As of March 31, 2017 and December 31, 2016, the short-term convertible notes had a principal balance of $165,000 with an unamortized debt discount of $0. The principal matures in April 2017 and has an annual interest rate of 10%. In April 2016 for a one-year extension of the maturity date of the outstanding notes, the holders of the notes were granted warrants at one common stock for $4.00 of the note amount, and warrants to purchase 41,250 shares of common stock were issued at a strike price of $1.50 and an expiration date of five years from date of issuance. The amendment of the note was considered a debt extinguishment and a loss on extinguishment of debt was booked in the amount of $37,579.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">Promissory Note</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">In May 2016, a promissory note was renewed in the face amount of $250,000 and the term was extended an additional year. The note has an original issuance discount of $45,000 and this amount was paid in cash at the renewal. During 2016, a debt discount of $30,000 was amortized. As of December 31, 2016, the promissory note has a balance of $235,000 with an unamortized debt discount of $15,000. During the three months ended March 31, 2017, debt discount of $11,250 was amortized and the balance was $246,250, net of $3,750 unamortized debt discount. </font></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In October 2016, a promissory note was issued in the face amount of $47,000. The term of the note was one year. Payments are made monthly and $3,917 of principal was paid in 2016. During the three months ended March 31, 2017 $11,750 of principal was paid and the balance was $31,333.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In September 2016, a promissory note was issued for $189,000. The term of the note is 494 days. The debt discount was $39,000 thus the initial net proceeds were $150,000. At December 31, 2016, $139,602 was classified as short term with a discount of $25,306 and $10,739 was classified as long term with a discount of $152. Payments are made each weekday in the amount of $537. At March 31, 2017, $34,900 was paid off by cash and debt discount of $10,007 was amortized. At March 31, 2017 the balance was $115,441, classified as short term with a discount of $15,451. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">As of March 31, 2017, short term promissory note has a balance of $377,573, net of $19,201 unamortized debt discount. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">Related Party </font></b><b><font lang="EN-US">Convertible Promissory Note</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">In August 2016, $40,000 in promissory notes were issued to Mr. Shilpa Patel, a relative of Mr. Prashant Patel. The term of the note was one year. Simple interest of 10% is payable at the maturity date of the note. Prior to maturity the note may be converted for common stock at a conversion price of $1.50. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">The Company evaluated the embedded conversion feature within the above convertible notes under ASC 815-15 and ASC 815-40 and determined that the embedded conversion feature does not meet the definition of a derivative liability. Then the Company evaluated the conversion feature for a beneficial conversion feature at inception. The Company accounted for the intrinsic value of a Beneficial Conversion Feature inherent to the convertible note payable and $0 was recorded as of the grant date. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">In September and October 2016, convertible promissory notes were issued in the aggregate amount of $211,725 to a related party, Mr. Nitel Patel, the brother of Mr. Prashant Patel. The term of the notes was one year. Simple interest of 10% is payable at the maturity date of the notes. Prior to maturity the notes may be converted for common stock at a conversion price of $.62. In connection with the notes, the holder of the notes was granted warrants to purchase 52,861 shares of common stock. These warrants were issued at a strike price of $.62 and an expiration date of five years from date of issuance.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">The Company evaluated the embedded conversion feature within the above convertible notes under ASC 815-15 and ASC 815-40 and determined that the embedded conversion feature does not meet the definition of a derivative liability. Then the Company evaluated the conversion feature for a beneficial conversion feature at inception. The Company accounted for the intrinsic value of a Beneficial Conversion Feature inherent to the convertible note payable and a total debt discount of $65,390 was recorded as of the grant date. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">At December 31, 2016, the short term related party convertible notes had a principal balance of $203,384, net of an unamortized debt discount of 48,341. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">During 2017, a debt discount of $26,347 was amortized. As of March 31, 2017, the short term related party convertible notes had a principal balance of $229,731, net of an unamortized debt discount of $21,994.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">Related Party </font></b><b><font lang="EN-US">Promissory Note</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In November 2016, Mr. Prashant Patel loaned the Company $10,000. The term of the loan is 90 days and is at zero percent interest. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In February 2017, $7,280 of accounts payable to Mr. Patel was added to the loan. The term of the loan was extended for 90 days and is at zero interest rate. The balance at March 31, 2017 was $17,280. </font></p></us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
eleList.name: RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 5 &#150; SHAREHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY </font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US" style='font-weight:normal'>In January, under a Private Offer Memorandum, 250,000 shares of common stock were issued for $250,000 cash. The common stock was sold at $1.00 per share. In connection with this common stock offering warrants to purchase 87,500 shares of common stock were issued with a strike price of $0.01 and an expiration date of five years. </font></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In addition, 50,000 shares were issued for services performed for the Company and valued at fair value of $12,500. </font></p></us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>
eleList.name: StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock
eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 5 &#150; SHAREHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY </font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US" style='font-weight:normal'>In January, under a Private Offer Memorandum, 250,000 shares of common stock were issued for $250,000 cash. The common stock was sold at $1.00 per share. In connection with this common stock offering warrants to purchase 87,500 shares of common stock were issued with a strike price of $0.01 and an expiration date of five years. </font></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In addition, 50,000 shares were issued for services performed for the Company and valued at fair value of $12,500. </font></p>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:CompensationAndEmployeeBenefitPlansTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 7 &#150; OPTIONS</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">The Company maintains a stock option plan under which certain employees are awarded option grants based on a combination of performance and tenure. The stock option plan provides for the grant of up to 2,000,000 shares. All options may be exercised for a period up to 10 years following the grant date, after which they expire. Options are vested in 4 or 5 years from the grant date.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">For the three-month period ended March 31, 2017, two option grants&#146; exercise period was extended to 10 years from the grant date. The option expense for the period associated with the extension was $60,041. No options were issued, and 105,500 options were forfeited or expired due to employee resignation. For the options not vested, the option expense reversed was $10,679. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">The Company uses the Black-Scholes option pricing model to estimate the fair value of stock-based awards on the date of grant. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">Total compensation cost related to stock options was $79,637 for the three months ended March 31, 2017. As of March 31, 2017, there was $116,154 of unrecognized compensation costs related to stock options, which is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 4.0 to 5.0 years. The following table represents stock option activity for the three- month period ended March 31, 2017: </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> eleList.name: CompensationAndEmployeeBenefitPlansTextBlock
eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 7 &#150; OPTIONS</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">The Company maintains a stock option plan under which certain employees are awarded option grants based on a combination of performance and tenure. The stock option plan provides for the grant of up to 2,000,000 shares. All options may be exercised for a period up to 10 years following the grant date, after which they expire. Options are vested in 4 or 5 years from the grant date.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">For the three-month period ended March 31, 2017, two option grants&#146; exercise period was extended to 10 years from the grant date. The option expense for the period associated with the extension was $60,041. No options were issued, and 105,500 options were forfeited or expired due to employee resignation. For the options not vested, the option expense reversed was $10,679. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">The Company uses the Black-Scholes option pricing model to estimate the fair value of stock-based awards on the date of grant. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">Total compensation cost related to stock options was $79,637 for the three months ended March 31, 2017. labels.xmlLine: <link:label xlink:type='resource' xlink:label='lab_us-gaap_CompensationAndEmployeeBenefitPlansTextBlock' xlink:role='http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label' xml:lang='en-US'>Options {1}</link:label>
<link:label xlink:type='resource' xlink:label='lab_us-gaap_CompensationAndEmployeeBenefitPlansTextBlock' xlink:role='http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/terseLabel' xml:lang='en-US'>Options</link:label>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 8 &#150; RELATED PARTIES</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">Trxade Group, Inc. owed management wages to Mr. Prashant Patel and Mr. Suren Ajjarapu at March 31, 2017 of $102,012 and $31,971, respectively and at December 31, 2016 of $132,012 and $76,971, respectively. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In January 2017 Mr. Ajjarapu and Mr. Patel suspended their executive salaries of $165,000 and $125,000, respectively, for a period of six months. All of our executives are at-will employees or consultants. Each of Messrs. Ajjarapu and Patel are parties to an at-will executive employment agreement.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">See related party debt activities in NOTE 4.</font></p></us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock>
eleList.name: DebtDisclosureTextBlock
eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 8 &#150; RELATED PARTIES</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">Trxade Group, Inc. owed management wages to Mr. Prashant Patel and Mr. Suren Ajjarapu at March 31, 2017 of $102,012 and $31,971, respectively and at December 31, 2016 of $132,012 and $76,971, respectively. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In January 2017 Mr. Ajjarapu and Mr. Patel suspended their executive salaries of $165,000 and $125,000, respectively, for a period of six months. All of our executives are at-will employees or consultants. Each of Messrs. Ajjarapu and Patel are parties to an at-will executive employment agreement.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">See related party debt activities in NOTE 4.</font></p>

labels.xmlLine: <link:label xlink:type='resource' xlink:label='lab_us-gaap_DebtDisclosureTextBlock' xlink:role='http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label' xml:lang='en-US'>Related Parties {1}</link:label>
<link:label xlink:type='resource' xlink:label='lab_us-gaap_DebtDisclosureTextBlock' xlink:role='http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/terseLabel' xml:lang='en-US'>Related Parties</link:label>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 9 &#150; CONTINGENCY</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">On November 19, 2015, Family Medicine Pharmacy, LLC filed a class-action claim against Trxade Group, Inc. and its wholly owned subsidiary Westminster Pharmaceutical, LLC, Inc. (Family Medicine Pharmacy, LLC v. Trxade Group, Inc. and Westminster, Inc., Case No.: 1:15-CV-00590-KD-B, United States District Court, Southern District of Alabama, Mobile Division). Family Medicine has served Trxade for allegedly utilizing a &#147;junk fax&#148; advertising program. On June 6, 2016, we entered a binding memorandum of understanding with the plaintiff related to this litigation to resolve all claims in exchange for Trxade funding a settlement fund in the amount of $200,000. The final judgment and approval was entered and funded on March 17, 2017 for $200,000. An accrual of $200,000 is recorded on book as of December 31, 2016.</font></p></us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
eleList.name: CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock
eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 9 &#150; CONTINGENCY</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt;text-autospace:'><font lang="EN-US">On November 19, 2015, Family Medicine Pharmacy, LLC filed a class-action claim against Trxade Group, Inc. and its wholly owned subsidiary Westminster Pharmaceutical, LLC, Inc. (Family Medicine Pharmacy, LLC v. Trxade Group, Inc. and Westminster, Inc., Case No.: 1:15-CV-00590-KD-B, United States District Court, Southern District of Alabama, Mobile Division). Family Medicine has served Trxade for allegedly utilizing a &#147;junk fax&#148; advertising program. On June 6, 2016, we entered a binding memorandum of understanding with the plaintiff related to this litigation to resolve all claims in exchange for Trxade funding a settlement fund in the amount of $200,000. The final judgment and approval was entered and funded on March 17, 2017 for $200,000. An accrual of $200,000 is recorded on book as of December 31, 2016.</font></p>

labels.xmlLine: <link:label xlink:type='resource' xlink:label='lab_us-gaap_CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock' xlink:role='http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label' xml:lang='en-US'>Commitments and Contingencies Disclosure</link:label>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><b><font lang="EN-US">NOTE 10 &#150; SUBSEQUENT EVENTS</font></b></p> <p style='margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In April 2017, $165,000 in convertible promissory notes (plus $5,500 in interest) was repaid. A two-year extension was executed on the remaining notes and the interest owed, totaling $16,500 became part of the adjusted principal of the notes and the balance of $181,500 is due May 2019. In connection with the two-year extension of the maturity date of the outstanding notes, the holders of the notes were granted&nbsp;warrants to purchase 18,150 shares of common stock&nbsp;that was&nbsp;issued at a strike price of $.65 and an expiration date of five years from date of issuance. The amendment of the note was considered a debt extinguishment and a loss on extinguishment of debt was booked in the amount of $11,512.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In April 2017, a $61,725 related party note was renewed for a one year extension at the same interest rate of 10%, due April 2018. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In April 2017, 253,846 options were granted with an exercise price of $.65 and exercise expiration of 10 years from the grant date. The options vest over a period of one and four years. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In April 2017, two option grants, totaling 250,000 options, were amended to extend the exercise term from 5 years to 10 years from the date of grant. </font></p></us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>
eleList.name: SubsequentEventsTextBlock

In connection with the two-year extension of the maturity date of the outstanding notes, the holders of the notes were granted&nbsp;warrants to purchase 18,150 shares of common stock&nbsp;that was&nbsp;issued at a strike price of $.65 and an expiration date of five years from date of issuance. The amendment of the note was considered a debt extinguishment and a loss on extinguishment of debt was booked in the amount of $11,512.</font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In April 2017, a $61,725 related party note was renewed for a one year extension at the same interest rate of 10%, due April 2018. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In April 2017, 253,846 options were granted with an exercise price of $.65 and exercise expiration of 10 years from the grant date. The options vest over a period of one and four years. </font></p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='text-align:justify;margin:0cm 0cm 0pt'><font lang="EN-US">In April 2017, two option grants, totaling 250,000 options, were amended to extend the exercise term from 5 years to 10 years from the date of grant. </font></p>
